questions.question: So this survivorship plan says follow-ups every three months for life, but how long before we might ease it a bit? After a couple of years, does it switch to six months or yearly, you know?
If I notice a new symptom, like a lump or swallowing getting worse, should I rush to urgent care or call the clinic for an earlier appointment, and how soon?
If the subsidy programs or transport help aren’t enough, are there other ways to get funding for follow-ups, meds, or devices?
How do we know when to go ahead with the feeding tube—if I’m not gaining weight—versus continuing oral intake; can we try to remove it later?
With my mouth drying out, am I looking at permanently worse dental health, and how often should I see the dentist now to prevent problems?
What about the HPV vaccine—should I get it now even after treatment, or is that something you’d discuss later based on risk and guidelines in India?
In the first year, will I actually get blood tests or endoscopy or imaging if I don’t have symptoms, or is everything symptom-driven?
Can I start swallowing or neck exercises at home now, and how will you track my rehab progress—weekly check-ins, videos, or what?
Since my job means long hours and travel, how flexible will the follow-ups be—will I get time off easily and can we use telehealth to skip some trips?
If we relocate to another state, will the care be the same, and how do we keep the MDT plan and tests coordinated with new doctors?
What signs should I not ignore at home or work—what are the red flags that mean I should seek review sooner?
When can we realistically expect energy, taste, and mood to improve, and is there a simple way to track milestones so Meera can help keep us on track?
